DRONES WILL BE ONE OF THE HOTTEST THEMES OF 2026

The ecosystem breaks down like this:
‚Ä¢ $UAVS drones used for farming & commercial work
‚Ä¢ $ONDS communication systems that let drones talk securely
‚Ä¢ $UMAC software that coordinates groups of drones working together
‚Ä¢ $JOBY, $ACHR, $EVTL, $EH electric aircraft designed to carry people
‚Ä¢ $AVAV, $KTOS, $RCAT, $AIRO the physical drones & mission hardware
‚Ä¢ $DPRO drone platforms used for training, operations & real-world deployment
‚Ä¢ $NOC, $LMT large-scale autonomous & defense systems integrated into military platforms

$GOOGL has seen its valuation double the past 8 months.

The market re-rated it from a search & ads biz at risk from AI to a platform that controls full AI stack that enables intelligence to be monetized across Google ecosystem.

My thesis is playing out faster than I expected.

THE INFRASTRUCTURE BEHIND THE $GOOGL AI EMPIRE

AI Chips
‚Ä¢ $AVGO helps Google design custom TPUs so it can lower AI chip costs & avoid $NVDA pricing
‚Ä¢ $TSM only foundry currently capable of producing Google‚Äôs leading-edge TPUs at scale with acceptable yields.
‚Ä¢ $ARM licenses the CPU architecture Google uses alongside TPUs for AI inference & control
‚Ä¢ $CDNS sells the software Google uses to design each new generation of AI chips
‚Ä¢ $SNPS provides chip testing/ IP so Google can ship complex TPUs without failures
‚Ä¢ $AMKR packages TPUs + memory together so Google can run them at data-center scale

AI Networking
‚Ä¢ $ALAB supports high-speed rack-level connectivity as Google scales TPU pods
‚Ä¢ $MRVL supplies custom networking chips inside Google‚Äôs AI data centers
‚Ä¢ $CRDO licenses data-transfer technology used inside Google‚Äôs AI hardware
‚Ä¢ $ANET supplies switches that route traffic inside Google‚Äôs AI clusters
‚Ä¢ $CIEN moves data between Google‚Äôs data centers over long distances

AI Utility
‚Ä¢ $CIFR supplies energy-backed sites supporting large AI workloads
‚Ä¢ $WULF operates power-dense infrastructure where large-scale compute can be deployed

AI Memory
‚Ä¢ $MU adds DRAM + HBM supply as Google expands AI inference
‚Ä¢ $WDC stores the massive datasets Google uses to train AI models

AI Optics
‚Ä¢ $LITE supplies optical components used inside Google‚Äôs AI data centers
‚Ä¢ $COHR provides lasers needed for high-speed optical data transmission

AI Power 
‚Ä¢ $VRT provides cooling infrastructure that keeps Google‚Äôs AI hardware onlin
Based on this data, the most undervalued SaaS names entering 2026 are $S, $MNDY & $OS.

The Portfolio Role of Bonds When Equities Are Overextended via @JDHatfield_ICAP @InfraCap 
open.substack.com/pub/infras‚Ä¶

The claim suggests deflationary periods (falling prices economy-wide) often begin with surges in commodity prices, like recent rises in silver, gold, and platinum.

Historical examples where true: The Long Depression (1873-1896) followed post-Civil War commodity booms in grains and metals, leading to oversupply and price collapses. The Great Depression (1929-1933) was preceded by late-1920s commodity spikes amid broader speculation.

Where not true: Japan's 1990s deflation followed a real estate/stock bubble, without major commodity mania. The brief 2008 deflation stemmed from a housing crisis, not pure commodity surges.

In reality, manias can trigger busts via debt or oversupply, but not all deflations start this way‚Äîsome arise from demand shocks or policy errors. Current metal rises may signal volatility, not guaranteed deflation.

When FX decouples from interest-rate logic, cross-asset signals become critical. 

Shifts in risk appetite, swap markets, and commodity demand can create opportunities (and risks) for investors relying on traditional carry trades.

#DynamicWealthGroup
